Clean Feature-level Data

clean_feature_data.Rd

This function cleans and filters feature-level (psm-level) data based on various criteria such as contaminant removal, isolation interference, and intensity thresholds. It also handles multiple PSM measurements per feature, removes single-shot proteins, and calculates basic statistics before and after filtering.

Usage

clean_feature_data(
  dat,
  metadata,
  filter.by.quaninfo = "auto",
  isolation.interference.cutoff = 75,
  collapse_psm_method = "TagPSM",
  filter.singleshot.proteins = "BYPEPTIDE",
  min.intensity = 0.01
)

Arguments

dat

A data.table containing the feature-level data.

metadata

A data.table containing metadata associated with the MS data.

filter.by.quaninfo

Character. Specifies the method for filtering MS data generated by PD based on quantitative information. Options are "auto", "none", or a specific label. Default is "auto".

isolation.interference.cutoff

Numeric or NULL. The threshold for filtering based on isolation interference. Features with interference above this value are removed. Default is 75.

collapse_psm_method

Character. Method for handling multiple PSM measurements per feature. Default is "TagPSM".

filter.singleshot.proteins

Character. Method for filtering single-shot proteins. Options are "BYPEPTIDE" or "BYFEATURE". Default is "BYPEPTIDE".

min.intensity

Numeric. Minimum intensity threshold below which intensity values are considered missing. Default is 0.01.

Value

A list containing the cleaned msDT, a BasicStats table with summary statistics, and Isol.Interference data.

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  • Removes rows where protein data is missing or marked as a contaminant.

  • Filters out single-shot proteins both before and after peptide filtering.

  • Removes features with intensities below the specified minimum threshold.

  • Filters features based on isolation interference and quantitative information.

  • Consolidates multiple PSM measurements per feature.

  • Outputs basic statistics before and after the cleaning process.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  clean_data <- clean_feature_data(dat = my_data, metadata = my_metadata)
} # }
